subtitle: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher announces suspension of ‘Delhi Chalo’ march for the day as many farmers got injured
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Delhi Chalo’ march highlights: Farmers stopped at Shambhu border, police fire tear gas shells Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher announces suspension of ‘Delhi Chalo’ march for the day as many farmers got injured

title: NCB secures conviction of accused in six drug seizure cases
subtitle: No Subtitle
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: NCB secures conviction of accused in six drug seizure cases No Subtitle The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has secured conviction of the accused in six cases of drug seizures in different parts of the country. On March 31, 2021, 332 kg of ganja was seized from a vehicle at Pedda Amberpet, Hyderabad. The vehicle was driven by Anil Babruwan Kale, who was transporting the consignment from Sileru, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, to Pune and Osmanabad.

title: Congress MP submits privilege notice against BJP's Patra for 'traitor' barb at Rahul Gandhi
subtitle: Congress MP Manickam Tagore had on Thursday written to Mr. Birla, expressing deep concern over Mr. Patra allegedly using "slanderous language" against Mr. Gandhi at a media interaction
author: Miscellaneous
content: Congress MP submits privilege notice against BJP's Patra for 'traitor' barb at Rahul Gandhi Congress MP Manickam Tagore had on Thursday written to Mr. Birla, expressing deep concern over Mr. Patra allegedly using "slanderous language" against Mr. Gandhi at a media interaction Congress MP Hibi Eden has submitted a notice to move a privilege motion against BJP MP Sambit Patra for his remarks calling Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi "traitor of the highest order", asserting that the usage of "completely defamatory and unparliamentary words" has clearly violated constitutional norms. In his letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, Mr. Eden said, "I wish to raise a motion of privilege and bring to your attention the completely unparliamentary conduct of Sambit Patra, MP Lok Sabha, against the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi." In a press conference held on December 5, Mr. Patra has referred to the Leader of Opposition as "traitor of the highest order" while making unfounded allegations against the LoP, he said.

title: Farmers postpone march to Delhi after Haryana police use tear gas
subtitle: Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital.
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Farmers postpone march to Delhi after Haryana police use tear gas Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital. Protesting farmers announced the suspension of their “Delhi Chalo” march after the Haryana Police used tear gas to disperse them at Shambhu on the Punjab-Haryana border on Friday (December 6, 2024). Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital. The farmers had also attempted to march to the national capital on February 13 and 21 but were stopped by police personnel at Shambhu and Khanauri on the Punjab-Haryana border. They were pressing for the fulfilment of their demands, with a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm loan waiver being the key ones.

title: PM Modi inaugurates Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav with a focus on  northeastern States
subtitle: Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a three-day cultural festival highlighting the eight States of the Northeast, being celebrated for the first time from December 6 to 8 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi
author: Miscellaneous
content: PM Modi inaugurates Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav with a focus on  northeastern States Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a three-day cultural festival highlighting the eight States of the Northeast, being celebrated for the first time from December 6 to 8 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav in New Delhi with a focus on the Northeastern States. “Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a celebration of a better future of the Northeast,” the Prime Minister said. He said that after the West-centric period, the 21st century belongs to the East, more specifically Asia and India. Mr. Modi expressed his firm belief that in the times to come, India’s growth story will encompass eastern India and the Northeast in particular.

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against politicians contesting Bar elections
subtitle: The Bench asked whether the petitioner was looking to oust senior advocates Kapil Sibal and Manan Kumar Mishra as the current SCBA president and BCI chairperson, respectively
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against politicians contesting Bar elections The Bench asked whether the petitioner was looking to oust senior advocates Kapil Sibal and Manan Kumar Mishra as the current SCBA president and BCI chairperson, respectively The Supreme Court of India on Friday (December 6, 2024) refused to entertain a petition against ‘active’ members of political parties contesting Bar elections and holding office in the Bar Council of India and States Bar Councils. Petitioner-advocate Jaya Sukin said serving judicial officers, government employees and Defence personnel are not allowed to join political parties or contesting elections.

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Modi govt will purchase all farm produce at MSP, says Agriculture Minister in Rajya Sabha
subtitle: Agriculture Minister also claimed the Modi government is already giving remunerative prices to farmers, saying that paddy wheat, jowar, soyabean were being purchased at 50% above the cost of production
author: Miscellaneous

content: Union Cabinet clears 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas, 28 Navodaya Vidyalayas The Ministry estimated that with the capacity of each KV at 960 students, the announcement would benefit 82,560 additional students The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs on Friday approved the opening of 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas and 28 Navodaya Vidyalayas. title: Amid protests over incidents in Bangladesh, Suvendu calls for ‘Hindu unity’ in Bengal
subtitle: Political observers feel that after the drubbing in the Lok Sabha polls and Assembly bypolls the BJP leadership in West Bengal sees developments in Bangladesh as an opportunity.
author: Shiv Sahay Singh
content: Amid protests over incidents in Bangladesh, Suvendu calls for ‘Hindu unity’ in Bengal Political observers feel that after the drubbing in the Lok Sabha polls and Assembly bypolls the BJP leadership in West Bengal sees developments in Bangladesh as an opportunity. As developments in Bangladesh continue to dominate political discourse in West Bengal, about 50 Hindutva organisations, accompanied by senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders, held a gathering at Esplanade on Thursday and called for “Hindu unity” in the State. Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari said that unlike other states, Hindus are not united in West Bengal. “In Uttar Pradesh Hindus have united under Yogi Adityanath ji, in Haryana Hindus have united, and now in Maharashtra, the land of Chatrapati Shivaji, Hindus have united,” Mr. Adhikari said, addressing a rally at Kolkata’s Rani Rashmoni Road. Since the arrest of ISKCON monk Chinmoy Krishna Das in Bangladesh on November 25, the West Bengal BJP leadership has been organising protests across the State.  Observers feel the BJP sees an opportunity in the unrest across the border after its dismal performance in West Bengal in the Lok Sabha polls. The party’s seats dropped from 18 to 12, and additionally it received a drubbing in the bypolls across 10 Assembly seats.

title: At ICJ hearing, India slams developed nations for climate crisis
subtitle: It said developing nations were the hardest hit by climate change, despite contributing the least to it
author: Miscellaneous
content: At ICJ hearing, India slams developed nations for climate crisis It said developing nations were the hardest hit by climate change, despite contributing the least to it India slammed developed countries for causing the climate crisis during a landmark hearing at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Thursday, saying they exploited the global carbon budget, failed to honour climate finance promises and are now demanding that developing countries restrict their resource use. The court is examining what legal obligations countries have to address climate change and the consequences if they fail.

title: Supreme Court to hear plea to reduce water level at Mullaperiyar dam in January 2025
subtitle: The petition filed by advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara referred to the recent landslides in Wayanad, which claimed over 220 lives, making it one of the worst natural disasters in recent times.
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Supreme Court to hear plea to reduce water level at Mullaperiyar dam in January 2025 The petition filed by advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara referred to the recent landslides in Wayanad, which claimed over 220 lives, making it one of the worst natural disasters in recent times. The Supreme Court on Friday (December 6,  2024) fixed in January a detailed hearing of a petition seeking to bring down the permissible water level of the Mullaperiyar Dam, situated in the Cardamom Hills of the Western Ghats, from 142 ft to 120 ft to obviate the possibility of the dam breaching. A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Ujjal Bhuyyan asked petitioner-advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara, who appeared online, to come and present his case in person in court.

content: Hashimpura massacre case 1987: Supreme Court grants bail to eight convicts Senior advocate Tiwari, representing four of the appellants, argued that the appellants have been in jail for more than six years since the High Court’s judgment The Supreme Court of India on Friday (December 6, 2024) granted bail to eight convicts in the infamous 1987 Hashimpura massacre case of 38 persons by the personnel of the Provincial Armed Constabulary. author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

title: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge

author: Peerzada Ashiq
content: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said National Conference MP Aga Syed Ruhullah on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said he would move an impeachment motion in Parliament against Justice Shekhar K. subtitle: The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The agency has submitted the prosecution complaint against Sikandar Singh, son of former MLA Dharam Singh Chokker, Mahira Infatech Private Limited, D S Home Construction Private Limited, and others.

title: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister
subtitle: Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure.
